Package com.gsm.repository

Interface SaleOrderRepository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<SaleOrder,​java.lang.Long>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<SaleOrder,​java.lang.Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<SaleOrder,​java.lang.Long>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<SaleOrder>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<SaleOrder,​java.lang.Long>
    @Repository
public interface SaleOrderRepository
extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<SaleOrder,​java.lang.Long>
    Spring Data JPA repository for the SaleOrder entity.

    • Method Detail

      • findBySaleOrderNo

        java.util.Optional<SaleOrder> findBySaleOrderNo​(java.lang.String saleOrderNo)
        Finds a SaleOrder by its unique, business-logic-driven saleOrderNo.
        Parameters:
        saleOrderNo - The sale order number to search for.
        Returns:
        An Optional containing the found sale order.

      • countByCustomer

        long countByCustomer​(Customer customer)
        Counts the total number of existing sale orders for a given customer. Used to generate the next sequential order number.
        Parameters:
        customer - The customer entity to count orders for.
        Returns:
        The total count of orders for that customer.

      • search

        @Query("SELECT so FROM SaleOrder so WHERE (:keyword IS NULL OR LOWER(so.saleOrderNo) LIKE LOWER(CONCAT(\'%\', :keyword, \'%\')) OR LOWER(so.customer.customerName) LIKE LOWER(CONCAT(\'%\', :keyword, \'%\')))")
java.util.List<SaleOrder> search​(@Param("keyword")
                                 java.lang.String keyword)
        Searches for sale orders using a keyword against the order number and customer name.
        Parameters:
        keyword - The term to search for.
        Returns:
        A list of matching SaleOrders.

      • findByStatus

        java.util.List<SaleOrder> findByStatus​(SaleOrderStatus status)
        Finds all sale orders that have a specific status.
        Parameters:
        status - The status to filter by.
        Returns:
        A list of matching SaleOrders.
